gate.ml.categorization

Class TextCategorizationPR

  • java.lang.Object
    • gate.util.AbstractFeatureBearer
      • gate.creole.AbstractResource
        • gate.creole.AbstractProcessingResource
          • gate.creole.AbstractLanguageAnalyser
            • gate.ml.categorization.TextCategorizationPR
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gate.creole.ANNIEConstants, gate.Executable, gate.LanguageAnalyser, gate.ProcessingResource, gate.Resource, gate.util.FeatureBearer, gate.util.NameBearer, Serializable

    @CreoleResource(name="Text Categorization PR",
                comment="Classify text based on a semantic space")
public class TextCategorizationPR
extends gate.creole.AbstractLanguageAnalyser
implements gate.LanguageAnalyser
    A simple text classification PR, using a Semantic Space implementation to generate vectors for the annotations to be classified, and a LIBLINEAR model to perform the actual classification.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • semanticSpace

        protected edu.ucla.sspace.common.SemanticSpace semanticSpace
        The semantic space used to generate 'document' feature vectors for the annotations to be classified.

      • vectorBuilder

        protected edu.ucla.sspace.common.DocumentVectorBuilder vectorBuilder

      • libLinearModel

        protected de.bwaldvogel.liblinear.Model libLinearModel
        The LibLinear model used for classification.

      • categoryThresholds

        protected double[] categoryThresholds
        Thresholds to be used when classifying text annotations. If the model classifies an input annotation as class "X", and "X" exists as a key in this map, then the classification is only effected if the classification probability emitted by the model is greater than or equal to the value in the map. Values in this map are expected to be probabilities, i.e. positive values between 0.0 and 1.0. All negative values are ignored and the default will be used instead (the category with the highest probability wins, regardless of what the probability actually is). Note that the liblinear model used must be able to produce classification probabilities. At the time of writing, only Linear Regression models are able to do so, while SVM-based one are not. Models that cannot supply probabilities will simply return 1.0 as the classification probability, causing values in this map to have no effect.

      • categoryLabels

        protected String[] categoryLabels
        The String labels for the categories (the LIBLINEAR classifier simply returns integer values for the labels).

      • stopWords

        protected Set<String> stopWords
        The set of stop-words to be used. The values in this list are matched verbatim against the values of the configured input feature on the input annotations.

      • stopWordsURL

        protected URL stopWordsURL
        URL to a file containing stop words, one on each line. Lines starting with # or // are considered comments and are ignored. White space at the start and end of each line's content will be ignored.

      • inputASName

        protected String inputASName
        The name for the annotation set used for input.

      • inputAnnotationType

        protected String inputAnnotationType
        The type of input annotations.

      • tokenAnnotationType

        protected String tokenAnnotationType
        The type for token annotations.

      • inputFeatureName

        protected String inputFeatureName
        The feature on token annotations used to collect the input text.

      • outputASName

        protected String outputASName
        The name for the output annotation set.

      • outputAnnotationType

        protected String outputAnnotationType
        The type of annotations produced. If this is the same as inputAnnotationType, and the input and output annotation sets are the same, then no new annotations will be created. The output feature value will simply be added to the input annotations.

      • outputFeatureName

        protected String outputFeatureName
        The name feature of the feature on the output annotations that stores the class.

      • sematicSpaceURL

        protected URL sematicSpaceURL
        URL for the file containing the serialized semantic space.

      • modelURL

        protected URL modelURL
        The URL to the LIBLINEAR model used for classification.

      • categoriesURL

        protected URL categoriesURL
        URL to a file defining the categories used by this PR.

        @CreoleParameter(defaultValue="Sentence",
